document_data.title: Sons of Gruumsh
document_data.author: [[Christopher Perkins]]
document_data.realm year: [[1374 DR]]<ref group="note">No date is given in the module. Its depiction of Melvaunt has very different noble leaders, their internal politics, and temples than that given in other sources, such as ''[[Mysteries of the Moonsea]]'', which was printed a year later. Therefore, it's assumed ''Sons'' is set after ''Mysteries'', which is set in the later half of [[1373 DR]]. Moreover, ''Sons''<nowiki>'s</nowiki> temple of Tyr has been present "for only a year" and is not apparent in ''Mysteries''. Ergo, ''Sons of Gruumsh'' is assumed to be set in mid- or late 1374 DR. This is also a common setting date for late 2005 sourcebooks.
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Sons of Gruumsh''''' is an adventure module for the ''[[Forgotten Realms]]'' campaign setting using the 3.5{{th}}-edition {{dnd}} ruleset.

{{quote|''None can escape the wrath of [[Gruumsh]]!''

''Trouble brews in [[Thar]] as [[orc]] tribes converge on the ruined fortress of [[Xûl-Jarak]], flocking to the banner of a charismatic warlord. What are their wicked intentions, and what connection do they have to the six missing nobles from [[Melvaunt]]?''

''The stand-alone [[wikipedia:Dungeons and Dragons|Dungeons and Dragons]] adventure is designed for 4th-level characters. Although set in the world of [[Faerûn]], it can easily be placed in any D&D campaign. To run the adventure, you need the ''[[Player's Handbook 3.5|Player's Handbook]]'', ''[[Dungeon Master's Guide 3.5|Dungeon Master's Guide]]'', ''[[Monster Manual 3.5|Monster Manual]]'', and the ''[[Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 3rd edition|Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting]]''. The adventure can be played using D&D Miniatures.''}}

document_data.Description: ''Sons of Gruumsh'' is set in [[Melvaunt]] and the [[Thar]] and sees player-characters pitted against a gathering [[orc]] army.
document_data.Summary: ''Sons of Gruumsh'' involves six missing nobles from Melvaunt, as tribes of orcs in Thar converge on the ruined fortress of Xûl-Jarak, flocking to the banner of a charismatic warlord.
